Explanation: The question describes a clear case of overfitting, where the model performs well on training data (90% accuracy) but significantly worse on test data (70% accuracy). To address overfitting and improve the model's generalization, applying regularization techniques is the most effective approach. L1 and L2 regularization, along with dropout, are well-known methods to reduce overfitting in deep learning models. These techniques help the model to learn more robust features and prevent it from relying too heavily on specific neurons or connections, thus improving its performance on unseen data.
